Is this orphaned?  I truly miss having a stock-sized 2 seat craft - as well as the inline <abbr title="Reaction Control System"><abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr></abbr> with parachute.  It just makes sense. This lets Gemini-Agena missions exist.  And even after I move on to bigger capsules, I use them all the time for rescues until the time where I have a space station and "space tug" set up.  And I have to admit, I always thought the Gemini was the coolest looking rocket.  I would do it myself, except I do not have a clue on how to do the dotnet stuff and textures, etc - back wehn i was a coder, ti was all Unix/Linux system-services stuff (old school) in C/C++/Perl /shell(awk and sed). Plus I'm deep into my second career in RL right now (cardiology), finishing off an advanced degree so I really do not have the spare cycles to code, barely any to play.  

If someone does take this up, be sure to post a patreon link, I'd love to buy you a couple pizzas and a case of beverages of your choice.

People are animals. Even if everyone acted with the best interests of the community in mind, it's easy to think of nightmare scenarios where the original creator of the mod has to deal with issues that were not created by him (or even he managed to *avoid* in his version, but someone else decided to "improve" it with a fork). A quick search around this forum will reveal many of those cases and that's why it's not uncommon for authors to pick restrictive licenses.

On a different note, assuming you're referring to US law (as many will now point out that 99% of this forum is *not* from the US), copyright does *not* expire after 75 years. Anything published after Disney's “Steamboat Willy” has indefinite copyright (the duration of copyright gets extended with 25 years every 25 years), at least in the US. YMMV depending on where you live though.

And thats the problem applying copyright law to something as ephemeral as source code.  The solution needs to be something more like Trademark law - if you abandon a trademark and fail to defend it, after a reasonable time, others can use it with impunity.  The print laws are inadequate to electronic media and....  nevermind, Soapbox not needed here, dragging things off topic.  The problem is, now that I've seen the mod, if I were to write something similar, could I be looked at for infringement?  In other words, would this have to be "clean room" to be reimplemented?  Otherwise I was thinking of taking something like a base set of code and models that are GPL/BSD/MIT, and use that as a basis. My biggest problem is that I dont have the time to take something like that on.  Im still in the deep end of things in cardiac peri- and postoperative care.  I'd dearly love to have a 2 kerbal stock capsule the same diameter as the Mk1, simply for gameplay, so I don't have to load and fiddle with 1.5, 1.875 and whatever other million things people that have the 2 man caps are doing.  Corvus was perfect for my purposes.    

Oh well.  I will probably get frustrated with KSP again and just set it aside and go read books.  Or I might even check out World Of Warcraft my old Army buddies are saying they want to play the new expansion (Nooooooo, huge time sink)
